The Vernam Cipher is a mechanism for encrypting and decrypting data that combines the plain text with a randomly-generated secret key byte by byte to yield a cipher text. To decrypt, the cipher text is combined with the same secret key byte by byte to arrive at the plain text. More information is available at Wikipedia and the Crypto Museum:

This application is open source. That means that anybody can go look at the source code, and if they want to, use the source code in their own projects. This also means that one can look at the code and see exactly what the application is doing and verify that it is doing what it says it does (and not doing anything it shouldn\'t, like sending your unencrypted data to the NSA). I don\'t trust any security/privacy related application that isn\'t open source, and you shouldn\'t either.

Please note that the source code has not been audited by an independent third party. If you or your organisation are interested in performing an audit, please contact me, my email address may be found at the bottom of this page.
